title: How to Make Holiday Panettone in a Jar

steps.headline: Measure and separate ingredients into small bowls.
steps.description: Prepare ingredients to build in container.

steps.headline: Clean and prepare the container.
steps.description: Make sure the container has been washed in warm soapy water, rinsed and completely dry before use.

steps.headline: Build dry ingredients inside container.
steps.description: Whisk yeast, sugar, flour and salt in a separate bowl. Pour combined dry ingredients into the container.

steps.headline: Add dried fruit.
steps.description: Build fruit, layer by layer. Make sure layers are completely even and packed into the flour mixture.

steps.headline: Seal the jar.
steps.description: Once it's all full, seal it up.

steps.headline: Make and attach the recipe tag.
steps.description:
It should read like this:
Empty panettone mix into a large bowl. Heat 1 cup whole milk, 1 stick of butter, 1/4 cup honey and 2 tablespoon (29.6 ml). grated lemon zest to 120 degrees. Stir into mix. Mix 2 beaten eggs and 1 tsp. vanilla extract into mixture. Cover with towel and allow to rise over one hour. The dough should double in size. Butter 2 5x9 loaf pans (or line with parchment paper). Pour mixture into loaf pans, cover and allow dough to rise for one hour. Place loaf pans in 350 oven and bake for 55 minutes

steps.headline: Wrap and decorate the jar for gifting!

text:
Measure and separate ingredients into small bowls. Prepare ingredients to build in container. Clean and prepare the container. Make sure the container has been washed in warm soapy water, rinsed and completely dry before use. Build dry ingredients inside container. Whisk yeast, sugar, flour and salt in a separate bowl. Pour combined dry ingredients into the container. Add dried fruit. Build fruit, layer by layer. Make sure layers are completely even and packed into the flour mixture. Seal the jar. Once it's all full, seal it up. Make and attach the recipe tag. It should read like this:
Empty panettone mix into a large bowl. Heat 1 cup whole milk, 1 stick of butter, 1/4 cup honey and 2 tablespoon (29.6 ml). grated lemon zest to 120 degrees. Stir into mix. Mix 2 beaten eggs and 1 tsp. vanilla extract into mixture. Cover with towel and allow to rise over one hour. The dough should double in size. Butter 2 5x9 loaf pans (or line with parchment paper). Pour mixture into loaf pans, cover and allow dough to rise for one hour. Place loaf pans in 350 oven and bake for 55 minutes Wrap and decorate the jar for gifting!  Finished.
